etymologies: early 16th century (as a Scots legal term meaning ‘legally pertinent’): from medieval Latin relevant- ‘raising up’, from Latin relevare

definitions: closely connected or appropriate to what is being done or considered

examples.text: what small companies need is relevant advice
the candidate's experience is relevant to the job

shortDefinitions: closely connected or appropriate to what is being done or considered

definitions: appropriate to the current time, period, or circumstances; of contemporary interest

examples.text: critics may find themselves unable to stay relevant in a changing world
her films are relevant for feminists today
